p: Thanks for you dear note. I do appreciate your wanting the girls in July, but I don't think there can be any question of Alice being in St Louis then. It would be lovely for you to have Hilda there for the 2 weeks before the comes Home for her vacation, but we want Alice Home as soon as she can leave after graduation. It is so sweet of you to plan for me to go track with you - but those things always cost money as a general thing. We are doing everything we can to keep the good work go
ing and are very happy in that it is going and looks good - but we are not allowing ourselves any indulgences.

At first I felt miserable not to see Alice, but Alice and Hilda helped a lot in their attitude, and so I am now definitely plainning not to go. It has been had enough to have to be away from our baby this whole year - and I see no reason why we should have to endure this separation any longer, once her school is out and her dancing teacher gone. So please don't place to keep Alice.
you dear children here - it will be grand, and don't neglect that Springfield plan, will you! I don't expect an answer in a letter so I put "!" instead of "?", See ?!

Mrs Leonard and Tracy, who is completely will now, brought me a big jar of strawberry preserves and a big basket of strawberries! Tracy remembered you and was glad for the good news I gave him of you Enid.
They liked the trust but of course Mr Leonard is the man to please, and he is
I hope you will see this bust before it is taken away. I am quite proud of it.
Daddy is making something new in ivory and I wonder what it is?! Our cannas are up! The garden is swell and the lawns are gorgeous.
We need to paint badly, so I gear we are not so clean as you are.
There are 2 caramine-red water lilies blooming today and 3 white ones or pale pink ones rather.
